column1: MILWAUKEE --   Milwaukee 's starting rotation is getting a lift from a journeyman right - hander who pitched in Italy just two years ago . 	 Junior Guerra is making a strong case for staying in the majors . 	 He pitched six innings of two - hit ball on Friday night
column2: leading the Brewers to a 1 - 0 victory over the San Diego Padres . 	 Making his third career major league start
column3: Guerra ( 2 - 0 ) shut down one of the National League 's lighter - hitting teams . He struck out four and walked two before three relievers finished the three - hitter . 	 " You 've got to keep learning -- three outings is n't enough
column4: " Guerra said through an interpreter when asked if he has proven that he belongs in the big leagues . " You 've just got to keep improving
column6: and see whatever happens . " 	 Guerra came out victorious in an unlikely
column7: low - scoring duel with Christian Friedrich
column8: who allowed four hits and walked six in six innings in his Padres debut after being promoted from Triple - A El Paso . 	 The Brewers scored on Chris Carter 's sacrifice fly in the first
column9: snapping a 23 - inning scoreless streak by Padres pitching . 	 " We had a pretty good first inning against Friedrich and he did a nice job the rest of the way
column10: " Milwaukee manager Craig Counsell said . 	 But Friedrich ( 0 - 1 ) still lost his 11th straight decision
column11: a streak that dates to 2012 . It was his first start in the majors since July 2014 . 	 Wiggling out of jams all night
column12: the left - hander stranded the bases loaded in the third and retired the side in order just once . 	 " He had a little trouble settling in
column13: " manager Andy Green said . " I thought he did a lot better when he started spinning the baseball more . I think he was a little fastball dominant in the first inning . " 	 At least the Padres held Ryan Braun hitless in three at - bats
column14: snapping his 12 - game hitting streak . Braun
column16: was also intentionally walked in the third . 	 JUNIOR 'S MINT 	 Guerra 's well - traveled route through professional ball includes stints in an independent league
column17: along with time in the Mexican League in 2012 and in Italy in 2014 . He caught on with the White Sox organization last season
column18: when he pitched three games in relief in the big leagues . 	 Guerra was claimed off waivers by the Brewers on Oct. 7
column19: the first transaction in general manager David Stearns ' tenure . 	 " If this was meant to be
column20: you 've got to take advantage of it now
column21: " Guerra said about getting his big league shot . 	 LIGHTS OUT 	 Despite the missed opportunities at the plate
column22: the one - run lead was safe with a Brewers bullpen that is lights - out with the lead in late innings . 	 Jeremy Jeffress finished with a strikeout for his ninth save
column23: preserving Guerra 's best start since he was called up on May 3 from Triple - A. 	 San Diego 's best scoring opportunity came in the fifth
column24: when Adam Rosales doubled to the left - field wall with one out before moving to third on a wild pitch . Guerra struck out Friedrich and got Jon Jay to bounce out . 	 Guerra also picked up his first major league hit with a single up the middle in the third . 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM 	 Padres : Green hoped starting pitcher Andrew Cashner would miss the minimum amount of time after going on the disabled list Friday for a strained right hamstring . The right - hander last pitched on Sunday
column25: taking the loss when the Padres fell 3 - 2 to the New York Mets . " He is back
column26: making a start
column27: I think we are looking at him the 24th in San Francisco
column28: " Green said . ... C Derek Norris might be out of the starting lineup for a couple days after getting hit on the left hand by a pitch on Thursday
column29: though Green said he would be available to pinch - hit . 	 Brewers : LHP Will Smith smiled after throwing off a mound for the first time since the reliever sprained his right knee in spring training . Smith
column30: who is on the 15 - day disabled list
column31: was supposed to share closing duties with right - hander Jeffress . 	 UP NEXT 	 Padres : Green announced after the game that reliever Luis Perdomo will start in Cashner 's place on Saturday . Green expects to rely heavily on the bullpen with Perdomo making his first career major league start . column1: DENVER -- The weight is off Jon Gray 's right shoulder now that his wait for a win has finally ended . 	 The hard - throwing Gray went seven stellar innings to earn that elusive first major league victory
column2: helping the Colorado Rockies beat New York 5 - 2 on Friday night to snap an 11 - game skid to the Mets . 	 In his 14th career start
column3: Gray ( 1 - 1 ) got the win and the baseball to go with it . The Rockies also gave him another baseball to commemorate his first major league base hit -- a single in the fifth . 	 " I feel on top of the world
column5: who struck out eight . " It 's a really good feeling
column6: overwhelmed with emotion . It took the tiredness away . It was a lot of fun . " 	 Gray received a loud round of applause as he walked off the field after the seventh when he struck out Curtis Granderson on his career - high 105th pitch -- a nasty 89 - mph slider . 	 " The kid is growing up quick
column8: " Rockies manager Walt Weiss said . " The biggest factor is his confidence . He 's really confident and knows he belongs now . " 	 Rookie shortstop Trevor Story had two doubles
column9: including one that brought in the go - ahead run in the fifth
column10: on a day when the Rockies found out that veteran shortstop Jose Reyes will be suspended through May 31 . The penalty stemmed from an alleged altercation with his wife at a Hawaii resort last October . 	 It was n't a distraction for Story . 	 " I treated it like a normal day
column11: " Story said . " Just get my work in and get ready for the game . " 	 Matt Harvey ( 3 - 5 ) struggled in his first start at Coors Field
column12: allowing five runs and a season - high 11 hits in 5 2/3 innings . What 's more
column13: his scoreless string against the Rockies was halted at 22 straight innings . 	 " It 's frustrating . From one start to the next
column14: it does n't feel the same at all
column15: " Harvey said . " It was n't the ballpark or anything like that . It was me . " 	 Gray started the season on the disabled list with an abdominal strain and has steadily found his command . He pitched seven scoreless innings in his last outing at San Francisco but wound up with a no decision . 	 This time
column16: it was a different story as the Rockies won their 1
column17: 000th game in the Mile High City . Gray started out sizzling
column18: striking out the side to open the game
column19: before surrendering a two - run double to Kevin Plawecki in the second . 	 The 2013 first - round pick of the Rockies allowed four more hits until he was taken out following the seventh . 	 " Jon was lights out
column20: " catcher Tony Wolters said . " I 'm so proud of him . He 's a joy to catch . " 	 The Rockies finally solved Harvey in the fourth
column21: ending a scoreless string against the righty that dated to Aug. 22
column22: 2012 . It was aided by a misread from outfielder Michael Conforto on Gerardo Parra 's sinking liner . The ball bounced past the charging Conforto
column23: allowing Nolan Arenado to score from first . Mark Reynolds followed with an RBI single to make it 2 - 2 . 	 " We just did n't give ( Harvey ) enough run support tonight
column24: " Plawecki said . 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM 	 Mets : LHP Steven Matz ( elbow soreness ) is progressing but has a visit with the doctor on Monday . " He 's not going to get carried away ( throwing ) until he sees the doctor
column25: " manager Terry Collins explained . 	 Rockies : INF Daniel Descalso ( broken left hand ) was reinstated from the disabled list . Descalso entered as a pinch hitter in the eighth and grounded out . ... To make room for Descalso on the roster
column26: the Rockies optioned INF Ben Paulsen to Triple - A Albuquerque . 	 THIS & THAT 	 Jake McGee pitched a perfect ninth to earn his 10th save . ... The Rockies are now 15 - 6 on Friday the 13th
column27: while the Mets fall to 24 - 27 . 	 COORS FIELD COMEDY 	 Collins drew some laughs his takes on Coors Field . 	 On calling the bullpen to bring in a reliever : " You hope they answer the phone . A lot of times they do n't . " 	 On playing the shift at such a cavernous field : " The fence keeps you from going too far . You have to stay on this side . I 'd be in the third row if I could put somebody ( there ) . " 	 UP NEXT 	 Mets : RHP Logan Verrett ( 3 - 0 ) will fill in for Matz on Saturday . It will be Verrett 's first start since April 19 at Philadelphia when he threw six scoreless innings in a win . column1: PHOENIX -- Joe Panik said he had never swung on a 3 - 0 pitch since he got to the major leagues . 	 When he did Friday night
column2: it turned out to be the swing that won the game . 	 Panik sent Shelby Miller 's pitch over the right field fence for a three - run homer that provided all the offense Jeff Samardzija and the San Francisco Giants needed in a 3 - 1 victory over the Arizona Diamondbacks . 	 When manager Bruce Bochy gave him the green light to swing
column3: Panik was ready . 	 " In a situation like that I 'm excited because you 've got a runner on third
column6: " he said . " I 'm just looking for a pitch I can drive . " 	 It was Panik 's second home run in two nights . 	 Samardzija ( 5 - 2 ) pitched out of trouble early and went eight innings for the third time this season
column7: giving up a run and scattering eight hits to improve to 4 - 1 in his last five starts . After throwing 123 pitches his last time out
column8: he threw 112 on Friday . 	 " We worked him hard last game
column9: " Bochy said . " Here he goes out and gets us eight innings and his stuff was just as good . " 	 Samardzija 's performance followed Johnny Cueto 's strong effort in the Giants ' 4 - 2 victory in the series opener Thursday night . 	 San Francisco 's top three pitchers
column12: are a combined 14 - 5 . 	 " You 've got to keep pace
column13: right ? " Samardzija said . " It 's awesome when you 've got guys in front of you that are doing that and showing you the way
column14: and you do n't want to let everyone down . " 	 Miller ( 1 - 4 ) blanked the Giants on four hits through five innings but faltered in the sixth
column15: allowing two singles before Panik 's home run . 	 " At that point of the game I felt like
column16: after getting that run in the bottom of the fifth
column17: I felt that the momentum was on our side
column18: " Miller said . " I was just frustrated about giving up three more runs in one inning . It gave them momentum with that home run and I was pretty upset about that . ` ' 	 Miller 's first career triple
column19: and Jean Segura 's RBI single
column20: had given Arizona a 1 - 0 lead in the fifth . 	 " It really fired me up
column21: man
column22: " Samardzija said . " I was not too happy with that . In a 0 - 0 game the last thing you want to do is break that tie giving it to the pitcher . I just wanted to make sure the rest of the game I redeemed myself . " 	 Miller went 5 2/3 innings
column23: giving up three runs on seven hits . 	 Left - hander Josh Osich retired left - handed hitting Jake Lamb for the first out in the ninth and Santiago Casilla came on to strike out the final two for his eighth save in 11 tries . 	 The visitor won for the 22nd time in the last 27 meetings between the teams . Arizona fell to 5 - 14 at home . 	 The Diamondbacks turned five double plays
column25: third
column26: fourth
column27: eighth and ninth innings
column28: to tie a franchise record . 	 Arizona stranded four runners
column29: three in scoring position
column30: in the first two innings . 	 CASILLA 'S SORRY 	 Casilla said before the game he had apologized to Bochy for his emotional outburst on the mound Thursday . Casilla was upset when Bochy pulled him with two outs and the bases loaded in the ninth inning . Bochy brought in lefty Javier Lopez to face left - handed hitting Lamb and got the Arizona batter to ground out to preserve the victory . 	 Casilla said after the game that he thought Bochy had shown a lack of confidence but said after thinking about it overnight that he was wrong . 	 " What was said is between us
column31: " Bochy said . " It 's over . " 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM 	 Giants : Angel Pagan was back in the lineup after missing 11 games with a hamstring strain . He singled and scored a run . ... RH reliever George Kontos was to make a final rehab appearance for Triple - A Sacramento Friday night . Bochy said Kontos could rejoin the Giants in San Diego on Tuesday . 	 Diamondbacks : OF David Peralta missed his fifth straight game with right wrist soreness . An MRI on Thursday did not reveal any structural damage . 	 UP NEXT 	 Giants : RH Jake Peavy ( 1 - 4

column2: C.J. Cron hit an opposite - field home run down the right field line . In the ninth inning
column3: he had an even bigger hit that barely got out of the infield . 	 Cron 's two - run bloop single with the bases loaded lifted the Los Angeles Angels to a 7 - 6 comeback win against the Seattle Mariners on Friday night . 	 The Angels had loaded the bases with one out against closer Steve Cishek ( 2 - 2 ) in the ninth . Cron 's short pop up landed just out of reach of shortstop Ketel Marte . Center fielder Leonys Martin and left fielder Nori Aoki charged in but could only watch as the ball fell and two runs scored . 	 " I knew I definitely did n't hit it far enough for an outfielder to catch
column4: " Cron said . " All I knew is it had to get past Marte
column5: and I thought it had a good chance . " 	 The Angels came into the game on a six - game losing streak
column6: and it looked like it would continue after they fell behind by four runs after six innings and trailed 6 - 3 going into the eighth . 	 " Man
column8: " Cron said . " We hit a rough patch . I do n't know what was going on
column9: but nothing was going right . It was a nice little comeback for us and we 're going to take it . " 	 Marte hit a three - run triple and Nelson Cruz and Chris Iannetta each hit solo home runs for the Mariners
column10: who ended a three - game winning streak . 	 Cron 's solo homer was his third of the year
column11: and Jefry Marte added a run - scoring double in the eighth to cut Seattle 's lead to one . 	 A baserunning error kept the Mariners from adding a run in the bottom of the eighth . With one out and Aoki on first
column12: Robinson Cano doubled to extend his hitting streak to 12 games . Aoki missed the base as he rounded second
column13: forcing him to backtrack . He ended up on third instead of having a chance at scoring . 	 " You do n't often see that either
column14: but it was a strange game tonight
column15: " Seattle manager Scott Servais said . " There was a lot of stuff that happened that we have n't seen happen to us early in this season . " 	 Joe Smith ( 1 - 2 ) loaded the bases with two outs by intentionally walking Kyle Seager before getting out of the inning without allowing a run . 	 Los Angeles starter Nick Tropeano pitched five innings and got into several jams
column16: but the Mariners offense had trouble scoring early . Seattle loaded the bases in the second and fourth innings but came away with only one run to show for it -- on Martin 's sacrifice fly . 	 " It was kind of a battle
column17: I put myself in too many high - pressure situations
column18: " Tropeano said . " I thought I made pitches when I had to
column19: and that was a great team win . They picked me up . " 	 Cruz gave the Mariners a 2 - 1 lead in the fifth with his seventh homer . In the sixth
column20: Seattle again loaded the bases and this time
column21: Marte tripled to the right - center gap -- past diving right fielder Kole Calhoun -- to clear the bases . 	 Seattle starter Nathan Karns cruised early
column22: then gave up singles to three of the first four batters in the seventh and left with the bases loaded and one out . Calhoun drove in a run with a sacrifice fly
column23: then Trout 's run - scoring double cut Seattle 's lead to 5 - 3 . 	 TRAINING ROOM 	 Mariners : Three relievers on the disabled list will test their arms Saturday . RHP Joaquin Benoit ( right shoulder inflammation ) and LHP Charlie Furbush ( biceps tendinitis ) will throw simulated games . RHP Tony Zych
column24: who went on the DL on May 2 with right shoulder tendinitis
column25: will have a light throwing session . 	 Angels : IF Cliff Pennington was placed on the 15 - day DL . He left Thursday 's game against the Cardinals with a left hamstring cramp . 3B Yunel Escobar also left Thursday 's game after jamming his thumb diving for a ball and was held out of the lineup Friday . 	 ROSTER MOVES 	 The Angels brought up infielders Gregorio Petit and Marte from Triple - A Salt Lake in response to Pennington and Escobar 's injuries . RHP Javy Guerra was also designated for assignment . 	 UP NEXT 	 Mariners : RHP Hisashi Iwakuma ( 1 - 4
column26: 4.19 ERA ) starts against the Angels in the second game of the series Saturday night . Iwakuma pitched eight innings at Los Angeles on April 22

column28: but got a no - decision as the Mariners won 5 - 2 in 10 innings . 	 Angels : RHP Jhoulys Chacin is making his first start for the Angels after being traded from the Braves on Wednesday . column1: LOS ANGELES -- Ross Stripling was in a celebratory mood and Michael Wacha was going to pay for it a second time after losing to his former college roommate . 	 Stripling earned his first victory in his seventh major league start and got his first big - league hit in his initial at - bat off Wacha
column2: Yasiel Puig homered and the Los Angeles Dodgers defeated the St. Louis Cardinals 8 - 4 Friday night in the series opener . 	 Stripling squared off against Wacha
column3: his former teammate at Texas A&M who -- as the loser -- was on the hook for a postgame dinner with their girlfriends . 	 " I 'm definitely getting the lobster
column4: " Stripling said . " Maybe a nice bottle of wine
column5: maybe a steak to go . " 	 He also wanted Wacha 's autograph on the ball he saved from his first hit
column6: a single in the second inning . 	 " He threw me maybe a belt - high fastball away and I was late as heck
column7: but kind of flipped it over there with the first baseman
column8: " Stripling said . " The first win will probably be the one that you cherish in the long run . " 	 Stripling ( 1 - 2 ) allowed four runs and eight hits in five - plus innings
column9: struck out two and walked three . He had two wild pitches
column10: including one that led to a run in the sixth . 	 " It was n't necessarily the sharpest game by any means
column11: " Stripling said . " I do n't think me and Wacha will look back and think of this as the best game we 've ever pitched . " 	 Stripling created a stir in his major league debut by taking a no - hitter through 7 1/3 innings before being pulled with it still alive on April 8 at San Francisco . It was one of four no - decisions Stripling has had
column12: along with two losses . Stripling avoided being the first Dodgers pitcher to go winless in his first seven - plus starts since Clayton Kershaw in 2008 . 	 Dodgers manager Dave Roberts thought Stripling lost his crispness after 75 pitches . 	 " That 's just been where I 've started my downfall
column13: " the rookie said . " I do n't know if it 's third time through the lineup they 're just starting to figure me out and I need to start playing the chess match better . " 	 Kenley Jansen retired two batters in the ninth to earn his 12th save . 	 Wacha ( 2 - 4 ) gave up a season - worst six runs -- two earned -- and eight hits in four innings
column14: his shortest outing of the season . He struck out two and walked three . The right - hander had a 1.71 ERA against the Dodgers in four previous starts . 	 " It was very cool facing him and seeing him up in the big leagues
column15: " Wacha said . " He 's a great guy
column16: great competitor
column17: great pitcher . Good for him
column18: but I wish it would n't have come tonight . " 	 Puig homered on the first pitch from Tyler Lyons leading off the sixth
column19: extending the Dodgers ' lead to 8 - 4 . It was his first homer since May 3 at Tampa Bay . He was 3 for 5 with two runs scored after going 2 for 15 with four strikeouts in the Dodgers ' four previous games against the Mets . 	 " He 's doing a lot of things well
column20: " Roberts said . " He 's a guy that builds on momentum
column21: so hopefully it carries over . " 	 The Dodgers ' eight runs were the most they 've scored at home this season and the most since they had eight against the Reds on Aug. 15
column22: 2015 . They came in averaging just 2.82 runs
column23: the second - lowest home mark in the majors . 	 " We definitely could 've limited some of that damage by making plays behind him
column24: " Cardinals manager Mike Matheny said of Wacha . 	 The teams combined for five errors
column25: including a season - high four by the Cardinals
column26: whose three - game winning streak ended . Aledmys Diaz committed three and Matt Carpenter had the other
column27: the Cardinals ' most since May 4
column29: against the Marlins . 	 Diaz homered in the fourth
column30: leaving St. Louis trailing 4 - 2 . In the sixth
column31: Kolten Wong tripled for the second time and scored on Stripling 's wild pitch with the Cardinals behind 7 - 4 . 	 In the second
column33: with the ball bouncing off the wall . Puig ran in from right field
column34: picked up the ball and fired to third
column35: but Wong was safe on the slide . He then got caught in a rundown after Diaz hit a comebacker to Stripling . 	 The Dodgers led 3 - 1 in the second on RBI singles by Trayce Thompson and Howie Kendrick . Joc Pederson added an RBI double in the third . 	 LEADING OFF 	 Kendrick batted leadoff for the first time this season and went 2 for 5 with an RBI and two runs scored . 	 " I know we 've got to get Howie going
column36: " Roberts said . " He 's a big part of what we 're trying to do . " 	 QUOTE OF THE NIGHT 	 " He 's one of those few generational players where every time he takes the mound
column37: I envision a dad telling the son
column38: ` Hey
column40: this could be one of the greatest of all - time

column1: BOSTON -- David Ortiz made sure he got to his daughter 's birthday party . 	 Big Papi may have picked up an extra gift from the field
column2: too . 	 Ortiz hit a winning double with two outs in the 11th inning after lining a tying triple in the ninth and earlier moving into 20th place on the career home run list
column3: sending the Boston Red Sox past the Houston Astros 6 - 5 on Saturday . 	 Ortiz was blasted with white powdery spray from his teammates at second base after the victory . He later walked off holding the bag over his head . 	 When it was over
column4: he met his son at his locker
column6: quickly got dressed and hustled out the door . 	 In a postgame interview
column7: the 40 - year - old Ortiz told the team 's NESN cable network : " You know when we 're playing at home you 've got the wonderful feeling from the fans . " 	 Hanley Ramirez was on deck when Ortiz delivered the winning hit and rushed out to celebrate . 	 " I was trying to tackle him . But man
column10: his emotion and how happy he was
column11: he 's got energy . Every time he comes here he 's laughing
column12: talking loud and it 's fantastic . " 	 Boston 's Jackie Bradley Jr. singled in the first inning
column13: extending the majors ' longest hitting streak to 20 games . 	 George Springer hit a grand slam and Carlos Correa a solo homer for the Astros . 	 Ortiz broke a tie with Ernie Banks and Eddie Mathews with his 513th homer
column14: a drive that cleared Boston 's bullpen and sailed into the bleacher seats . The shot in the third was his 10th of the season . 	 Houston led 5 - 4 with two outs in the ninth when Ortiz hit an RBI triple just past diving center fielder Jake Marisnick . After sliding into third
column15: he got up and pumped both fists toward his dugout following his first triple since June 15
column16: 2013 . 	 Ramirez then tried to bunt on the first pitch
column17: but closer Luke Gregerson threw him out . 	 In the 11th
column18: Xander Bogaerts singled with two outs against Michael Feliz ( 1 - 1 ) and advanced on a wild pitch . Ortiz hit a drive off the base of the center - field wall for his 600th career double to win it . 	 Ortiz joined Hank Aaron and Barry Bonds as the only major leaguers with at least 500 home runs and 600 doubles . 	 " He got us twice
column19: " Astros manager A.J. Hinch said . " Once in the ninth and once in the 11th inning
column20: both to the middle part of the field . " 	 Koji Uehara ( 2 - 1 ) pitched a scoreless 11th for the win . 	 Jose Altuve reached five times with two singles and three walks for the Astros . 	 Houston starter Collin McHugh gave up four runs over six innings . 	 Springer 's slam off Clay Buchholz caromed off a billboard above the Green Monster seats to make it 5 - 2 in the second . Springer homered for the third time in four games
column21: and for the second straight day at Fenway Park . 	 There was a spattering of boos before Buchholz was booed louder as he walked off after the inning 's last out . Buchholz was charged with five runs in six innings
column22: but held Houston scoreless over his final four . 	 Correa 's homer completely left the park over the Monster

column1: Jim Bowden explains what having Dellin Betances
column2: Andrew Miller and Aroldis Chapman together at the back end of the bullpen can mean for the Yankees . ( 0:52 ) 	 NEW YORK -- Yankees manager Joe Girardi unwrapped his new bullpen toy Saturday and unleashed it on the Chicago White Sox . 	 Ballgame over . 	 Dellin Betances
column3: Andrew Miller and Aroldis Chapman combined for eight strikeouts and scoreless relief as New York used its three big arms in the same game for the first time to secure a 2 - 1 victory . 	 " We knew these would be the type of games that we would use all three of them
column4: and that if we could line them up
column6: " Girardi said . 	 Ivan Nova pitched neatly into the sixth inning to give New York 's ailing rotation a much - needed boost . Aaron Hicks hit an RBI double and Didi Gregorius
column8: added a run - scoring single with two outs in the second . 	 That was enough to squeeze past the stingy White Sox ( 24 - 13 )
column9: who began the day with the best record and lowest ERA ( 3.13 ) in the American League . Todd Frazier hit his 12th home run for Chicago
column10: which has lost three of four overall -- and 11 of the past 14 matchups with New York . 	 " If you do n't get anything early
column11: you 're going to end up with that back end of the bullpen
column12: " White Sox manager Robin Ventura said . " All of them are closers
column13: really . " 	 Jose Quintana ( 5 - 2 ) pitched seven strong innings in a hard - luck loss . The left - hander
column14: let go by the Yankees when he was in the low minors
column15: entered leading the AL with a 1.38 ERA that rose to 1.54 . He won his previous four starts
column16: compiling a 0.64 ERA over 28 innings . 	 Making his second effective start this season in place of injured CC Sabathia
column17: and only hours after the last - place Yankees put struggling Luis Severino on the disabled list with a strained triceps
column18: Nova ( 2 - 1 ) gave up four hits in 5 2/3 innings . 	 Featuring a sharp sinker
column19: he got 13 of his 17 outs on grounders and handed a 2 - 1 lead to the imposing bullpen after walking Frazier on his 74th pitch . 	 " I do n't think you can ask for much more
column20: " Girardi said . " Nova is doing his job . Wherever we 've put him
column21: he 's done his job this year . He 's thrown the ball well . " 	 From there
column22: it was lights out . 	 Betances struck out all four batters he faced
column23: Miller fanned two in a one - hit eighth and Chapman whiffed a pair in a 1 - 2 - 3 ninth for his second save
column24: hitting 102 mph on the stadium radar gun and finishing a crisp game that took only 2 hours
column25: 24 minutes . 	 " It was fun . I think a lot of the guys enjoyed it
column26: " Betances said . " Chapman is like a video game . He 's impressive . He 's a show every time he goes out there . " 	 It was exactly the sort of end - game formula the Yankees had in mind when they acquired Chapman from Cincinnati for four prospects in December . The hard - throwing lefty joined the team Monday after serving a 29 - game suspension under baseball 's new domestic violence policy . 	 " It seems like it 's a recipe for victory
column27: " Miller said . 	 New York relievers have thrown 15 2/3 consecutive scoreless innings . 	 " That 's the strength of our team is get the lead and hand the ball off to those guys down there
column28: " catcher Brian McCann said . " It 's a luxury for the whole team . It 's impressive what they 're able to do . " 	 One day after Chicago ace Chris Sale threw a six - hitter for a 7 - 1 win in the series opener
column29: the Yankees mustered little offense again . 	 Quintana walked Chase Headley with two outs in the second before Hicks doubled over the head of right fielder Adam Eaton . Gregorius followed with a single that made it 2 - 0 . 	 Gregorius had to stop at third on Austin Romine 's ground - rule double
column30: and New York never scored again . 	 Not a problem
column31: though . 	 " We got the three - headed monster to finish the game
column32: " Gregorius said . 	 Frazier homered in the fourth . 	 " It seemed like Girardi could n't wait to get Betances in there
column33: " Frazier said . " They dominated . " 	 ONE THAT GOT AWAY 	 Quintana went 10 - 2 with a 2.91 ERA in 30 games ( 12 starts ) for high - Class A Tampa in New York 's farm system in 2011 . He became a minor league free agent after the season and wanted a spot on the 40 - man roster to re - sign with the Yankees
column34: general manager Brian Cashman said . They balked . " We liked him . We did n't love him
column35: " Cashman said Saturday . " He was a performer
column36: but not someone with ceiling . " Cashman said the White Sox were the only team to offer Quintana a 40 - man roster spot
column37: and now they 're reaping the rewards . 	 BREAKTHROUGH 	 New York had lost 18 straight games when failing to score three runs . 	 TOUGH TRIP 	 Chicago has dropped 12 of its last 14 games at Yankee Stadium . 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM 	 Yankees : After missing seven games since straining a right hip muscle on May 6

column1: WASHINGTON -- Stephen Strasburg could n't deny he experienced a different vibe in his latest start compared to all others this season . 	 Perhaps a change was expected after signing a lucrative long - term contract earlier this week . At least the result remained the same . 	 Strasburg remained undefeated and struck out seven over six innings in his first start since signing a seven - year
column3: and the Washington Nationals defeated the Miami Marlins 6 - 4 in the opener of Saturday 's day - night doubleheader . 	 Strasburg ( 6 - 0 ) allowed three runs and five hits for his second victory over the Marlins this season . 	 " It felt a little different
column4: " Strasburg said of taking the mound following Tuesday 's attention - getting announcement . " I think as the season gets back in the swing and all the talking subsides
column6: you get back in your routine . " 	 Washington 's lineup routine will undergo a change for the second game . Bryce Harper dropped his appeal and will serve a one - game suspension in the nightcap . The reigning NL MVP was suspended and fined Wednesday by Major League Baseball for his behavior following an ejection in Monday 's 5 - 4 win over Detroit . 	 After the ejection
column7: pinch hitter Clint Robinson connected for a game - winning home run . Harper
column8: who by rule should not have been in the dugout after getting tossed
column9: ran onto the field with his teammates to celebrate
column10: pointed toward Knight and cursed at the umpire . 	 Washington has won three in a row
column11: including two straight to open the four - game series with Miami . 	 Jayson Werth 's RBI single capped a three - run first inning for Washington off Justin Nicolino ( 2 - 1 ) . Wilson Ramos hit a solo home run in the sixth as five Nationals drove in at least one run . 	 Though not sharp
column12: Strasburg never surrendered the early lead despite the Marlins ' peskiness . He matched his season - high with three walks
column13: hit one batter and allowed at least one base runner in every inning . 	 " It was a struggle for him most of the day
column14: but he kept us in the game
column15: " Nationals manager Dusty Baker said of Strasburg . 	 The right - hander became the first starting pitcher in Nationals / Expos history to start a season 6 - 0 since Pedro Martinez went 8 - 0 to begin the 1997 season . 	 Christian Yelich homered and drove in two runs for Miami
column16: which has lost five of seven . 	 Jonathan Papelbon
column17: one of three relievers backing up Strasburg
column18: pitched the ninth for his 11th save . 	 Nicolino allowed four runs on five hits with five walks -- including the first three batters faced -- in 4 2/3 innings . 	 Staked to a 1 - 0 lead on Yelich 's homer
column19: Nicolino 's inability to find the strike zone cost him immediately . 	 After he walked Harper to load the bases
column20: sacrifice flies by Daniel Murphy and Ryan Zimmerman drove in runs . Harper stole third base and scored on Werth 's single for a 3 - 1 lead . 	 " It took three hitters to finally get in the zone
column21: " Nicolino said
column22: " but that 's just bad pitches right there and not helping myself out . " 	 Miami scored single runs in the fifth and sixth off Strasburg only for Washington to counter in the bottom of both innings as rain fell
column23: eventually turning the infield muddy . 	 Yelich homered over the center field wall in the first inning and then peppered the left field wall for an RBI double in the fifth . 	 Michael Taylor reached base four times with a double
column24: single and two walks for the Nationals . He also scored twice and stole a base . 	 STICKER SHOCK 	 Harper 's " Make Baseball Fun Again " campaign resumed with a presidential - themed " MBFA 2016 " decal on the bottom of his bat . The slugger used a " 100 " emoji sticker earlier this season . 	 LUCKY STREAK 	 Marlins CF Marcell Ozuna 's went 2 for 4
column25: extending his hitting streak to 13 games . With eight multi - hit games during that stretch
column26: he raised his batting average from .218 to .302 . 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM 	 Nationals : Washington rested outfielder Ben Revere for the opening game with Taylor starting in center . ... Outfielder Matt den Dekker was added from Triple - A Syracuse as the 26th man for the doubleheader . He pinch - hit in the eighth

column1: CHICAGO --   Jake Arrieta regained his form right after Anthony Rizzo 's towering drive landed in the bleachers in right field . 	 The unbeaten ace took over from there . 	 Arrieta struck out 11 in eight innings
column2: Rizzo drove in four runs and the Chicago Cubs remained perfect against the Pittsburgh Pirates with an 8 - 2 victory on Saturday . 	 Arrieta improved to 18 - 0 with a microscopic 0.75 ERA in 20 regular - season starts since Aug. 1 . The Cubs have won his last 21 starts
column3: extending a franchise record . 	 " It 's unusual
column4: " manager Joe Maddon said with a chuckle . " It 's very unusual what he is doing . " 	 Arrieta ( 7 - 0 ) allowed three hits and two runs
column5: leaving with a major league - best 1.29 ERA . After Rizzo 's 11th homer made it 3 - 2 in the fourth
column6: the reigning NL Cy Young Award winner struck out seven while finishing his outing with four hitless innings . 	 " That was a huge swing of the bat by Anthony
column7: " Arrieta said . " It picked me up . " 	 Rizzo also singled in Jason Heyward in the eighth and is among the major league leaders with 33 RBI . Heyward finished with three hits
column8: Ben Zobrist reached four times and Addison Russell hit a two - run homer as Chicago improved to 5 - 0 against Pittsburgh this year . 	 The 27 - 8 record for the Cubs is baseball 's best start since the 1984 Detroit Tigers won 30 of their first 35 games . 	 " We 're just plugging away right now and understanding that we 've got to get up for every ballgame
column9: " Heyward said . 	 Bouncing back from a so - so start for his lofty standards
column10: Arrieta moved to 8 - 1 in 11 career regular - season starts against the Pirates . He also struck out 11 in a five - hit shutout at Pittsburgh in last year 's wild - card game . 	 Francisco Cervelli hit a two - run single for Pittsburgh in the fourth
column11: but the Pirates lost out on an opportunity for more when Josh Harrison 's liner went off Arrieta 's left foot and right to Zobrist at second for an inning - ending double play with runners on the corners . 	 " There were tipping points throughout the game
column12: " Pittsburgh manager Clint Hurdle said . " The fourth inning was one . " 	 The Cubs then grabbed the lead for good in the bottom half . Heyward singled on a dribbler to second and Kris Bryant walked on a close call on a full - count pitch before Rizzo connected against Jeff Locke ( 1 - 3 ) . 	 " I got into a little bit of rhythm for a little a while but the Rizzo home run kind of knocked that off course
column13: " Locke said . 	 Likely upset by the call on Bryant
column14: Pirates pitching coach Ray Searage was thrown out by plate umpire Brian Knight on a visit to the mound later in the inning . 	 Locke also served up Russell 's fourth homer with one out in the sixth and then hit Miguel Montero before he was replaced by Jared Hughes . Locke was charged with six runs and six hits . 	 " I thought Jeff was really strong through three then a couple of mistakes
column15: a couple of elevated pitches and they took advantage of them
column16: " Hurdle said . 	 Zobrist went 2 for 3 with two walks and is batting .536 ( 15 for 28 ) on the Cubs ' 10 - game homestand . Dexter Fowler had two hits and drove in a run . 	 MONTERO RETURNS 	 The Cubs activated Montero from the 15 - day disabled list and designated outfielder Ryan Kalish for assignment . Montero had been sidelined by lower back tightness . column1: CLEVELAND --   Juan Centeno 's first major league home run ball sat in a small plastic bag on the top shelf of his locker . 	 Minnesota 's backup catcher will remember the moment for a long time . 	 Centeno 's two - run homer off Corey Kluber in the fifth inning put Minnesota ahead for good and the Twins ended an eight - game losing streak with a 6 - 3 win over the Cleveland Indians on Saturday . 	 " It 's awesome
column3: showing the ball to reporters as a large smile came over his face . " A go - ahead homer
column5: whose contract was selected from Triple - A Rochester on May 6
column6: appeared in his fourth game . He doubled in the ninth and walked in the third . 	 Centeno
column8: played in 24 games with the New York Mets and Milwaukee from 2013 - 15 . Not only did his homer help break a losing streak
column9: it came off the pitcher who won the AL Cy Young Award in 2014 . 	 " It 's got to be a thrill
column10: and to have Kluber as your first
column11: that 's something to brag about for a long time
column12: " Twins manager Paul Molitor said . 	 The win also gave Molitor a chance to smile after his team avoided its second nine - game losing streak of the season . The Twins began the season 0 - 9 . 	 " It 's good to win
column13: " he said . " It feels like it 's been a long time . The discouragement
column14: it 's been there . You have to find a way to get one on the board and see where it goes . " 	 Ervin Santana ( 1 - 2 ) allowed one run in six innings . The right - hander gave up five hits and struck out five in his second start since returning from a back injury . 	 Kluber ( 2 - 5 ) allowed four runs in 6 2/3 innings and lost his second straight start . 	 Eddie Rosario
column16: Danny Santana and Miguel Sano also drove in runs for Minnesota . 	 Minnesota was tied with Atlanta for the worst record in the majors and won on the road for the third time in 19 games . 	 Yan Gomes hit a solo homer in the ninth for Cleveland . 	 Jose Ramirez 's bloop single to left gave Cleveland the lead in the fourth
column17: but the Indians could n't do anything else with Santana
column18: who is 2 - 6 in 10 career starts at Progressive Field . His first victory came when he threw a no - hitter on July 27
column19: 2011 while pitching for Angels . 	 " He changed speeds like he always does
column20: and we never got a ton going
column21: " Indians manager Terry Francona said . " He was good the whole game . " 	 Minnesota scored in an unusual sixth inning . Left fielder Rajai Davis lost his footing and could n't come up with Trevor Plouffe 's fly ball
column22: which was ruled a hit . 	 Following Byung Ho Park 's single
column23: the umpires met as rain began to fall . Kluber 's next pitch hit Brian Dozier on the leg and bounced off the neck of catcher Gomes
column24: loading the bases . 	 Rosario 's RBI fielder 's choice gave Minnesota a 3 - 1 lead . Nunez added a sacrifice fly in the seventh . Santana and Sano added RBI singles in the ninth . 	 GOOD ITEM 	 Centeno plans on getting a case for his first home run ball . He also has kept the ball from his first big league hit

column2: Fla. --   Matt Andriese won for the second time in two starts this week and earned the chance to remain in the Tampa Bay Rays ' rotation . 	 The right - hander pitched a two - hitter for his first career shutout
column3: leading the Rays to a 6 - 0 victory over the Oakland Athletics on Saturday night . 	 " You never take that ( spot ) for granted . I felt like every day I 'm fighting for myself
column4: " Andriese said . " Today helped me build on that and I 'm pretty excited about the outing . " 	 Andriese ( 2 - 0 ) struck out five and walked none
column5: and retired 11 straight between singles by Matt McBride in the third inning and Danny Valencia in the seventh . 	 Andriese helped the Rays end a four - game losing streak . He beat the Los Angeles Angels 3 - 1 on Sunday in his first start since being called up from Triple - A Durham . 	 Manager Kevin Cash
column6: who declared after the game that the 26 - year - old Andriese will remain in the rotation
column7: said there was n't much discussion about going to the bullpen . 	 " We would have had there been any traffic on base
column8: but he controlled the game about as well as you could and he kept his pitch count down low
column9: " Cash said . " Then it was just -- let 's see how each inning goes . " 	 Oakland manager Bob Melvin was also impressed by Andriese 's repertoire . 	 " A pretty good mix of pitches
column10: " Melvin said . " He 's got some deception ... curveball
column13: changeup . ( His ) fastball gets on you a little bit . That 's two good starts in a row for him . " 	 In only his second start of the season and 10th of his major league career
column14: Andriese pitched the Rays ' first complete game of the season and matched Chris Archer for the most wins by a Rays starter . 	 " It 's always nice to get a complete - game shutout
column15: but that was n't in my thought process at all
column16: " said Andriese

column18: it kind of set the tone and we were able to settle in and get some runs
column19: " said Miller

column1: BALTIMORE -- Limited to a pair of singles through five innings
column2: the Baltimore Orioles went to their favorite weapon -- the long ball -- to produce a flurry of runs that turned a close game into a rout . 	 Jonathan Schoop hit two home runs
column4: and the Orioles defeated the Detroit Tigers 9 - 3 Saturday night to stretch their winning streak to seven games . 	 Matt Wieters and Adam Jones also connected for Baltimore
column5: which upped its AL - leading home run total to 54 . The Orioles wiped out a 2 - 0 deficit by scoring nine runs from the sixth through eighth innings . 	 " This team is capable of doing anything
column6: " Schoop said . " No matter if you 're losing by seven
column9: you believe you can score the same amount of runs . " 	 Schoop hit a solo shot in the seventh and his second career slam in the eighth to finish with a career - high five RBI . 	 Mike Wright ( 2 - 3 ) gave up two runs and three hits over seven innings . Most importantly
column10: the rookie kept Baltimore within striking distance . 	 " With our bats
column11: if we can just keep them without scoring eventually we 're going to find some barrels
column12: " Wieters said . 	 Miguel Cabrera homered for the Tigers
column13: who have lost 11 of 12 . Cabrera 's two - run homer in the sixth ended Detroit 's run of 17 straight scoreless innings
column14: but the Tigers need a win Sunday to avoid a four - game sweep . 	 " It 's one of those things we have to fight through
column15: " catcher James McCann said . " You hear a lot of talk about external pressure
column16: but again the highest expectations are from the guys in this room and right now we 're not living up to those expectations . " 	 Wieters hit a two - run drive in the sixth inning to put Baltimore up 3 - 2 and Schoop added his first home run of the game in the seventh . Both long balls came off Anibal Sanchez ( 3 - 4 )
column17: who 's struggled after the fifth inning this season . 	 " It 's almost like the sixth inning is a wall he hits
column18: " manager Brad Ausmus said . " His pitch count was down . I do n't think he was tired . " 	 Jones connected off Drew VerHagen in the eighth
column19: and Schoop completed the rout with a no - doubt drive off Mark Lowe . 	 Brad Brach yielded a run in the eighth but got three outs in the ninth for his first save . 	 After Cabrera put Detroit ahead 2 - 0
column20: Jones hit a one - out double in the bottom half and scored when left fielder Steven Moya misjudged a liner by Mark Trumbo that went for an RBI double . Wieters then hit a 3 - 2 pitch into the right - field seats . 	 Detroit used a an RBI single by Victor Martinez to close to 4 - 3 in the eighth
column21: but the Orioles ended all suspense in the bottom half . 	 " Every time we were able to do something
column22: we gave up a run or gave up the lead in the next half inning
column23: " Ausmus lamented . " You ca n't win that way . " 	 The flurry of runs in the latter part of the game followed a five - inning duel between Wright and Sanchez in the early going . 	 Detroit used a single and two walks to load the bases with one out in the third for Cabrera
column24: who hit a soft liner to second base that Schoop fielded on one hop and turned into a 4 - 6 - 3 double play . 	 BLAME GAME 	 Before the game

column26: fourth - place Tigers simply might not be that good . 	 " I think the team is good

column1: PHILADELPHIA -- Cameron Rupp had n't taken a shot this hard since his days playing high school football in Texas . 	 Tyler Goeddel threw out Eugenio Suarez with Rupp holding onto the ball following a violent collision to end the game
column2: and the Philadelphia Phillies held on to beat the Cincinnati Reds 4 - 3 on Saturday night . 	 " I sacrificed
column4: who was n't aware of an abrasion on top of his forehead . " I do n't how I caught it . " 	 Rupp played middle linebacker and fullback at Prestonwood Christian Academy in Plano
column5: Texas . 	 " I was usually the one hitting people
column6: " Rupp said . " It was fun . Definitely an adrenaline rush . " 	 Aaron Nola ( 3 - 2 ) tied a career high with nine strikeouts in seven stingy innings
column7: Odubel Herrera hit a solo homer and David Hernandez pitched out of a jam for his first save since July 12
column9: for Arizona against Milwaukee . 	 With setup man Hector Neris and closer Jeanmar Gomez unavailable
column10: Hernandez entered to protect a two - run lead . 	 Jay Bruce walked to start the ninth
column11: Suarez hit a single and Adam Duvall followed with a double to left to cut it to 4 - 3 . After Tucker Barnhart grounded out to first base
column12: pinch - hitter Jordan Pacheco hit a fly ball to left . 	 Goeddel made a perfect
column14: who held on despite Suarez crashing into him . Rupp stayed down briefly
column15: but was up before the umpires completed a review to determine he did n't block the plate illegally . 	 " I put everything into the throw
column16: and Cam made a great play
column17: " Goeddel said . 	 Manager Pete Mackanin called it a " perfect throw . " 	 " What a way to end the game
column18: " Mackanin said . " Fantastic . " 	 Nola gave up two runs
column19: one earned
column20: and five hits . He struck out Tucker Barnhart and pinch - hitter Ramon Cabrera to leave runners on second and third in the seventh . 	 The upstart Phillies have won three in a row
column21: six of seven and are 22 - 11 since opening the season 0 - 4 . They 're an MLB - best 14 - 3 in one - run games . 	 Cincinnati 's Tim Adleman ( 1 - 1 ) allowed three runs and eight hits in five innings in his third career start . 	 Herrera gave the Phillies a two - run cushion in the seventh when he lined a shot that bounced off a fan 's hands in the right - field stands and back on the field . A video review upheld the call and an exuberant Herrera screamed in celebration and high - fived teammates in the dugout . 	 The Phillies took a 3 - 1 lead in the fifth on consecutive RBI singles by Herrera and Cesar Hernandez . 	 Duvall 's RBI double down the left - field line cut it to 3 - 2 . But Nola escaped more trouble . The 2014 first - round pick mixed his pitches nicely and got five of his strikeouts on off - speed stuff . 	 " It 's frustrating
column22: " Barnhart said . " We had opportunities . " 	 Ryan Howard followed Maikel Franco 's double with an RBI double off the wall in right - center to tie it at 1 in the fourth . 	 The Reds loaded the bases on two singles and a walk to start the game
column23: but only scored one run . Zack Cozart raced home on Brandon Phillips ' sacrifice fly
column24: a foul pop to first baseman Howard . 	 STANDINGS 	 The Phillies moved seven games over .500 for the first time since finishing the 2011 season with a franchise - record 102 wins . The last - place Reds dropped to 14 - 22 with their fifth loss in six games . 	 STREAKING 	 Nola is 3 - 0 with a 1.32 ERA in his last five starts . 	 " He has a great way about him
column25: " Mackanin said . " He knows how to make adjustments . He 's a lot of fun to watch . " 	 SLUMP BUSTERS 	 Howard was 3 - for-26 before his RBI double . Herrera was 1 - for-16 vs. the Reds before his go - ahead single . 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM 	 Reds : RHP Anthony DeSclafani threw 25 pitches in a bullpen session . DeSclafani has n't pitched this season because of a strained left oblique . 	 Phillies : INF / OF Cody Asche was 2 - for-4 with a two - run homer in his second rehab game at Single - A Clearwater . column1: WASHINGTON --   Marcell Ozuna has benefited from having Barry Bonds as his hitting coach in a few ways . 	 For starters
column2: Bonds is letting Ozuna use his bats
column3: and the Miami Marlins center fielder is getting a lot of use out of them . 	 Ozuna had three hits
column4: he and J.T. Realmuto each drove in two runs and the Marlins beat the Washington Nationals 7 - 1 to split a doubleheader on Saturday night . 	 The Nationals won the opener 6 - 4 behind six strong innings from Stephen Strasburg . Soon after the final out
column5: Washington announced that Bryce Harper had dropped his appeal of a one - game suspension and would sit out the nightcap for his behavior following an ejection on Monday . 	 The Marlins battered Nationals starter Tanner Roark ( 2 - 3 ) for seven runs in five innings . 	 Ozuna had five hits in the doubleheader and extended his hitting streak to 14 games . During that stretch -- which began on April 30
column6: the same day he started using Bonds ' bats -- Ozuna has nine multihit games . He raised his batting average from .218 to .313 . 	 The superstitious 25 - year - old did n't have interest in talking about any streak specifics -- " I do n't need it . It 's OK . " -- but he 's very focused on those special bats . 	 There 's just one problem : Inventory . 	 " ( Bonds ) gave me the opportunity to swings his bat
column9: two - run single sparked a four - run fifth inning . " I feel great swinging that bat . Just ordered more because I broke so many . " 	 Justin Bour blasted a solo home run off Roark
column10: who allowed eight hits in his third straight trying start against Miami this season . In those three losing outings
column11: Roark allowed 16 runs -- 14 earned -- on 24 hits over 15 innings . 	 " He did n't have it from the beginning when he hit the first batter
column12: then could n't control the zone like he usually does
column13: " Nationals manager Dusty Baker said of Roark . 	 Led by Jose Urena ( 1 - 0 )
column14: Miami 's bullpen allowed one run and four hits over six innings . Starter Kendry Flores exited after three innings with a right shoulder strain . 	 Harper went 0 for 2 with three walks and a stolen base in the opener . 	 The Nationals had won three in a row
column15: including two straight to open the four - game series with Miami . 	 The Marlins led 3 - 0 when Flores left . Urena
column16: the first of four Miami relievers to enter after Flores
column17: allowed one run in three innings after pitching one inning in the loss . 	 " Obviously today is big
column18: " Marlins manager Don Mattingly said . " You do n't want to get in here ( Sunday ) with a chance of getting swept . " 	 In the first game
column19: Strasburg ( 6 - 0 ) struck out seven over six innings in his first start since signing a $ 175 million
column20: seven - year deal this week . He allowed three runs and five hits . 	 " It felt a little different
column21: " Strasburg said . " I think as the season gets back in the swing and all the talking subsides
column23: you get back in your routine . " 	 Jayson Werth 's RBI single capped a three - run first inning for Washington off Justin Nicolino ( 2 - 1 ) . Wilson Ramos hit a solo home run in the sixth as five Nationals drove in at least one run . 	 Harper
column25: was suspended and fined for his behavior following an ejection in a 5 - 4 win over Detroit . 	 After the ejection
column26: pinch - hitter Clint Robinson connected for a winning home run . Harper
column27: who by rule should not have been in the dugout after getting tossed
column28: ran onto the field with his teammates to celebrate
column29: pointed toward home plate umpire Brian Knight and cursed at him . 	 Christian Yelich homered and drove in two runs in the opener for Miami . Slugger Giancarlo Stanton went 1 for 10 and left 10 runners on base in the doubleheader . 	 STICKER SHOCK 	 Harper 's " Make Baseball Fun Again " campaign resumed with a presidential - themed " MBFA 2016 " decal on the bottom of his bat . The slugger used a " 100 " emoji sticker earlier this season . 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM 	 Marlins : Flores was placed on the 15 - day DL after the win . 	 Nationals : Washington rested three starters in the second game

column1: MILWAUKEE -- The game was getting close to five hours long
column2: the bullpen was taxed and the San Diego Padres were out of position players . 	 Two days after getting hit by a pitch on his left hand
column3: Derek Norris and Melvin Upton Jr. combined for a one - two punch in the top of the 12th inning to help end a roller - coaster of a game . 	 Norris and Upton hit back - to - back solo homers off reliever Chris Capuano in an 8 - 7 win over the Milwaukee Brewers on Saturday night . Upton 's deep shot off Capuano ( 1 - 1 ) ricocheted off the black backdrop beyond center for a two - run lead . 	 Carlos Villanueva
column4: the eighth pitcher used by the Padres
column5: picked up his first save despite allowing Jonathan Lucroy 's first - pitch homer to draw Milwaukee within a run with one out . He retired the next two hitters to close out the 12th . 	 " You 've got a lot of guys in this clubhouse that are mentally tough . We stick together . We know it 's going to be a grind
column7: who was just recalled from Triple - A El Paso
column8: tossed two scoreless innings of relief for his first major league win . 	 The Padres hung on despite committing four errors
column9: including two that came in a two - run eighth inning that allowed the Brewers to tie it at 6 . The Brewers had fallen behind by four runs in the fifth . 	 San Diego pitchers allowed 12 walks . Catcher Hector Sanchez
column11: was called twice for interference -- the second time in the eighth in a play that allowed the Brewers to load the bases for Alex Presley . 	 Presley lined a hard smash to first for an RBI single . The second run scored after second baseman Jose Pirela retrieved the loose ball in short right
column12: but threw wildly home . 	 But the Brewers wasted too many other opportunities and stranded a season - high 16 runners . 	 " It 's a frustrating game . Obviously
column13: when you have that many baserunners
column15: " manager Craig Counsell said . " We did such a great job coming back and the bullpen did a great job holding the line there . " 	 BASERUNNING BLUNDER 	 The Brewers ' ninth ended with a double play after Scooter Gennett struck out swinging and Jonathan Villar was thrown out trying to steal third base . That call was confirmed on replay review . 	 " That was a mistake
column16: " Counsell said . " Earlier in the count
column17: that 's a play that makes sense
column18: getting to third early . At that point
column19: it was n't a good decision . " 	 INTERFERENCE TIMES TWO 	 The game marked the first time that the Padres had been called twice in a game for catcher 's interference . Counsell said he thought Sanchez may have been going after the ball a little too aggressively those times . 	 Said manager Andy Green : " I do n't recall ever seeing two in a game . That 's an unfortunate circumstance . He caught very well
column21: especially the one late . " 	 KEMPT UP 	 Matt Kemp snapped an 0 - for-14 skid by going 3 for 6 and finishing a triple short of the cycle . Wil Myers went 2 for 5 and hit back - to - back homers with Kemp in the fifth . 	 " The game was so long
column22: I actually forgot that Matt and Will did it
column23: " Upton said . 	 AFTER 12 	 Green said he would have fielded a makeshift lineup that included catcher Christian Bethancourt pitching if the game had stretched into the 13th inning . 	 " It was going to be really interesting . There were literally no options left at that point
column24: " Green said . 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM 	 Padres : Myers left in the top of the ninth after suffering a cramp in his left calf while running out a fielder 's choice . Green said it was a precautionary move . ... Norris ( left hand ) took batting practice and replaced Myers at first in the bottom of the ninth . 	 Brewers : LF Ryan Braun was a late scratch because of a sore right wrist . Braun who is hitting .367
column25: had a 12 - game hitting streak snapped Friday . He did not appear as a pinch hitter . 	 UP NEXT 	 Padres : RHP Cesar Vargas ( 0 - 2 ) makes his fifth start since being called up from Double - A San Antonio on April 23 . The pitching staff has allowed runs in the first inning of each of the last two games following a 23 - inning scoreless streak . column2: Texas -- Eight days into his second stint with the Texas Rangers
column3: Drew Stubbs is finding new ways to help his ballclub win . 	 Stubbs homered with two outs in the 10th inning
column4: helping the Rangers beat Toronto 6 - 5 on Saturday night after the Blue Jays rallied with consecutive homers in the ninth to force extra innings . 	 It was the Rangers ' first walk - off win of the season and their third victory in four games . It broke a four - game Texas losing streak to Toronto
column5: which rallied last fall from a 2 - 0 deficit to win the teams ' Division Series . 	 Stubbs was released by the Rangers on March 29 after joining Texas for last season 's stretch drive . He signed with Atlanta the following day
column6: was released on May 3 and rejoined the Rangers last week as a free agent . 	 " Just to step in in a spot like that after a week
column9: whose main contributions are as a base runner and late - inning defensive replacement . " I knew I got the good part of the bat on it
column10: but I was a little out front . " 	 Stubbs homered over the left field fence off Gavin Floyd ( 1 - 3 ) 	 Justin Smoak hit a two - run homer and Troy Tulowitzki followed with a tying shot off closer Shawn Tolleson in the ninth . Tolleson has a 7.07 ERA and has blown two of his last four save opportunities . 	 Tony Barnette ( 3 - 2 ) got the last four outs for Texas
column11: allowing a two - out double by Jose Bautista in the 10th . 	 Texas ' Bobby Wilson hit his second grand slam of the week and his second homer of the season in the second inning . Wilson
column13: rejoined Texas recently after joining the team during the second half of last season en route to the AL West title . 	 " I 'm grateful for them believing in me
column15: reacquired from Detroit on May 3 after being traded to the Tigers on March 29 . 	 " Different players in different scenarios step up
column16: show up and do things
column17: " Texas manager Jeff Banister said . " It just happened to be Stubbs and Wilson tonight . " 	 " It 's tough sometimes to tie on the road ; you 've got to take the lead because they 've got the last at - bat
column18: " Blue Jays manager John Gibbons said . " But we battled
column19: like we always do . " 	 Wilson 's homer came on the 11th pitch of his at - bat against Toronto starter Marco Estrada . 	 " I was getting a little frustrated at myself fouling off some pitches that were decent pitches to hit
column20: " Wilson said . 	 Wilson hit his first grand slam of the season last Sunday at Detroit off Mark Lowe . 	 Rangers starter Colby Lewis allowed two runs in seven innings on four hits and struck out six
column21: one short of his season high . He has worked at least six innings in all eight starts this season
column22: seven being quality starts . Lewis went into the game with a 3 - 6 career record and 6.97 ERA against Toronto . 	 SOAKING IT IN 	 RHP Matt Bush said he got a good night 's sleep after making his major league debut Friday night
column23: 12 years after being the No . 1 draft choice . Bush retired all three batters he faced
column24: opening with a strikeout of reigning AL MVP Josh Donaldson . 	 Bush said his father brought him a bacon cheeseburger late Friday night since " I 've kind of been forgetting to eat these last couple of days
column25: " he said . 	 SELECT COMPANY 	 Wilson became the fourth major leaguer to hit two grand slams this season . He joined Houston 's George Springer
column26: who also hit his second on Saturday
column27: Baltimore 's Manny Machado and Washington 's Bryce Harper . 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM 	 Blue Jays : CF Kevin Pillar ( chest soreness ) was scratched from the starting lineup
column28: replaced by Ezequiel Carrera
column29: and entered the game in the bottom of the ninth . 	 Rangers : RF Shin - Soo Choo ( calf strain ) will begin a rehab assignment with Triple - A Round Rock on Sunday at Albuquerque . 	 UP NEXT 	 Blue Jays RHP Aaron Sanchez ( 4 - 2 ) has the AL 's ninth - best ERA ( 2.58 )
column30: which ranks third on the team . He has won four of his last six starts . Rangers LHP Cesar Ramos ( 0 - 2 ) will make his fourth appearance of the season and second spot start . He pitched 4 1/3 innings of scoreless relief against Toronto on May 5 . 	 Randy Arozarena celebrates with his family at home after learning he won the 2021 AL Rookie of the Year . column1: DENVER -- Tony Wolters should have been a strikeout victim in the third inning . He turned a second chance into a game - breaking hit . 	 Wolters hit a key two - run double after he appeared to swing and miss at strike three
column2: and the Colorado Rockies beat the New York Mets 7 - 4 on Saturday night . 	 Wolters and DJ LeMahieu with two hits and two RBI
column3: and Trevor Story and Gerardo Parra also had two hits for Colorado
column4: which has won three straight at home for the first time this season . 	 They got the win thanks to the favorable call when Wolters faced Mets starter Logan Verrett with the bases loaded in the pivotal third . Verrett 's fastball hit the dirt
column5: but home plate umpire Carlos Torres ruled Wolters had fouled off the 3 - 2 pitch . Replays showed Wolters did n't make contact . 	 " I fouled it off
column6: " Wolters said with a smile . 	 New York manager Terry Collins argued the call and was ejected . Wolters made it worse for the Mets with a double to center that made it 5 - 1 . 	 " It 's unfair . There is no reason for it
column7: " Collins said . " The hitter turned around and walked back to the dugout . It does n't matter what I said
column8: it does n't matter what he heard
column9: the call stood . Replay is dictated . You ca n't challenge it . It cost us the game . " 	 Wolters said he did n't try to convince Torres he had fouled it off . 	 " He sold it for me
column10: " Wolters said . " I appreciate it . Carlos
column11: thank you . " 	 Charlie Blackmon had a two - run single one out later to push the lead to 7 - 1 . 	 Verrett ( 3 - 1 ) struggled in the same place where he earned his first win in his major league debut . Verrett gave up just one run in eight innings on Aug. 23
column13: but was pulled in the third Saturday . 	 " He shut us down when he got the start against us last year
column14: " Rockies manager Walt Weiss said . " He likes to clip corners
column16: front and back . He got a good feel to pitch
column17: but I thought we made him work . " 	 Neil Walker had three hits
column18: including a solo home run
column19: for the Mets
column20: who have lost three straight and four of their last five . 	 Rockies starter Eddie Butler ( 2 - 1 ) allowed four runs on nine hits in five - plus innings for the win . Jake McGee pitched the ninth for his 11th save . 	 Butler
column21: who pitched six shutout innings in San Francisco for his first win Sunday
column22: notched his first win at Coors Field since April 24
column25: " Weiss said . " He did a nice job . " 	 Walker 's leadoff homer in the fourth -- his 10th and first since April 27th -- and two more runs in the sixth made it 7 - 4 . Gonzalez German relieved Butler after the first two batters reached in the inning and worked out of the jam . 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM 	 Mets : Collins said 3B David Wright will probably sit out Sunday 's game . It is a normal day of rest for Wright
column26: who has struggled at the plate . He has struck out 45 times this season . He was 2 for 5 Saturday night with two strikeouts . 	 Rockies : LHP Jorge De La Rosa ( strained left groin ) made a rehab start for Triple - A Albuquerque . De La Rosa allowed three runs -- two earned -- on five hits and struck out five in 3 2/3 innings . 	 SLIDING DOWN 	 Rockies : Struggling OF Carlos Gonzalez was moved from third to fifth in the lineup . Gonzalez has not hit a home run in 24 games
column27: his longest slump since 2012 . Gonzalez has not had an RBI since April 24
column28: a span of 17 games . 	 " I think he 's putting a lot of pressure on himself being in that three - hole and he 's struggling right now
column29: " Weiss said . " And I know he 's wearing it . He 's grinding right now . " 	 Gonzalez was 0 for 4 and saw his average drop to .287 . 	 UP NEXT 	 Mets : RHP Jacob deGrom ( 3 - 1
column30: 2.12 ERA ) is 2 - 0 in two starts against Colorado . He has not allowed a run to the Rockies in 15 innings against them . 	 Rockies : RHP Tyler Chatwood ( 4 - 3

column2: Albert Pujols hushed a fervent crowd on a wild Saturday night at Safeco Field . 	 Pujols hit a three - run
column3: ninth - inning home run to fuel the Angels second rally in Los Angeles ' 9 - 7 victory over the Seattle Mariners . 	 The Angels trailed 2 - 1 before taking the lead with a five - run seventh
column4: but then Seattle came back with a five - run eighth that ignited the crowd of 42
column5: 088 . Steve Clevenger had a two - out RBI single to cap the inning for a 7 - 6 lead heading into the ninth . 	 Closer Steve Cishek ( 2 - 3 ) could n't save it . With one out
column6: he hit Kole Calhoun with a pitch and Mike Trout singled to right . Pujols then hit his eighth home run on a 1 - 1 slider
column7: sending patrons quietly toward the exits . 	 " It was like that the whole game
column11: who earned his third save in four opportunities . " To do that in this environment
column12: it 's pretty cool . 	 " Everyone likes the cheering and stuff but sometimes that silence is even better . " 	 The Mariners had come back from a 6 - 2 deficit in the eighth . Adam Lind had two of his four RBI in the rally . 	 " You have to keep playing . It 's a game where you get 27 outs
column15: " Calhoun said . " We definitely used the ninth inning to put some good bats together and came out of here with a win . 	 " ( Pujols is ) awesome
column16: man
column17: " Calhoun added . " He 's been doing this for a long
column18: long time . We 're glad to have him on our team . He 's definitely going to do something to help the team win every single day . He 's been like that for 16 years or so . " 	 Cishek said when he entered the game he was fully confident that he could finish the job . 	 " Just got too aggressive with a slider
column19: " Cishek said . " I did n't get my hand on top of the ball
column21: the team paid for it . There was no doubt . As soon as I released
column22: it did n't come out of my hand right . It was loud off the bat . He put a great swing on it . No doubter . " 	 The Mariners lost Friday 's game on a ninth - inning RBI by C.J. Cron
column23: also off Cishek . 	 " Just going to wear it tonight and try to get some sleep
column24: " Cishek said . " Once the sun comes up
column25: Lord willing
column26: I 'm just going to come back at it again . " 	 Johnny Giavotella
column27: Calhoun and Trout each homered during Los Angeles ' five - run seventh . 	 " Electricity in the ballpark
column28: I thought our fans were unbelievable tonight
column29: " Mariners manager Scott Servais said . " I looked around during the rally
column30: and it 's like
column31: ` That 's what it should be like . ' Tip my hat to them . It was a good ballgame . It was entertaining
column34: it had everything . " 	 Cam Bedrosian ( 1 - 0 ) got one out in the eighth inning . 	 TOUGH DEAL 	 The Angels have to deal with three aces over their next three games . They begin Sunday against Seattle 's former Cy Young Award winner Felix Hernandez ( 3 - 2
column35: 2.27 ERA ) . Then Monday they open their four - game series at the Dodgers against Kenta Maeda ( 3 - 2
column36: 2.30 ) followed by former Cy Young winner Clayton Kershaw ( 5 - 1
column37: 1.74 ) . Those three are a combined 11 - 5 with a 2.06 ERA and 148 strikeouts in 148 innings . 	 EXTRAS IN MAY 	 Seattle 's Kyle Seager
column38: who doubled in the seventh
column39: leads the Majors with 11 extra - base hits thus far in May. Seager had just eight for all of April . 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM 	 Angels : The Angels
column40: with seven players on the DL
column41: got a break with third baseman Yunel Escobar . Escobar jammed his thumb Thursday diving for a ball and the club feared he would be out for some time . But he missed just one game and returned to the lineup Saturday . 	 Mariners : Both LHP Charlie Furbush ( left biceps tendinitis ) and RHP Joaquin Benoit ( right shoulder inflammation ) threw simulated games Saturday . " Both threw the ball really

column1: LOS ANGELES -- Scott Kazmir found velocity and stamina for the Los Angeles Dodgers on Saturday night . 	 Kazmir pitched 8 2/3 solid innings for his best outing of the season
column2: Adrian Gonzalez and Corey Seager homered and the Los Angeles Dodgers beat the St. Louis Cardinals 5 - 3 on Saturday night . 	 The Dodgers have won three consecutive games and eight of their last 10 . 	 Kazmir ( 3 - 3 ) allowed three runs on five hits
column3: struck out seven and walked one . He was nearly flawless until Jeremy Hazelbaker hit a pinch - hit
column4: two - run home run to pull the Cardinals within two in the ninth . Closer Kenley Jansen recorded the final out for his 13th save in as many opportunities . 	 With two outs
column6: and Kazmir put his hands to his head . He did the same after Hazelbaker 's home run chased him . 	 " It felt like I kind of got punched in the gut right there
column7: " Kazmir said . " That 's the way the baseball Gods are right now . Just going to keep on going . " 	 Still
column8: it was good news for Kazmir
column9: who had been battling a wrist injury . Kazmir 's velocity was consistently in the low 90s
column10: even through the ninth inning . He was in command for his finest performance of the season . 	 " It sounds like the ( wrist injury ) played a factor
column11: " Dodgers manager Dave Roberts said . " He was n't throwing his changeup as much earlier as far as with the injury
column12: but now he feels confident with the change and his velocity is coming back . He says he feels 100 percent and obviously
column14: it seems like that 's the truth . " 	 Gonzalez hit a home run
column16: to lead off the fourth inning . Seager
column17: who had three hits
column18: ripped a solo home run in the seventh inning . That softened the sting of his two errors . 	 " It makes your game better
column19: " Seager said . " It 's not exactly nice . It 's definitely a positive
column20: but you still do n't ever want it to ever happen . You do n't ever want it to be put on your shoulders . You want to be accountable for it and you want to make every one . That 's baseball . You 're not going to . " 	 The Dodgers scored three runs in the fifth after Cardinals right - hander Carlos Martinez ( 4 - 3 ) loaded the bases with no outs . Martinez
column21: who reached 101 mph on his fastball
column22: left after that having allowed five runs on five hits . He walked three and struck out two . 	 " I battled a lot tonight
column24: " Martinez said through an interpreter . " That 's a good club over there
column25: and they made good swings . " 	 Martinez pitched on seven days rest after leaving his previous start due to fatigue and illness . Aside from Gonzalez 's home run
column26: he worked his way out of trouble until the fifth
column27: when he threw 40 pitches . 	 Dean Kiekhefer made his major league debut for the Cardinals . He struck out four in 1 2/3 innings but allowed Seager 's home run in the seventh inning . 	 Kazmir allowed two home runs in his previous start and has allowed 10 this season . He was one out away from not giving up a home run in this game . He even had a bunt single in the fifth inning
column28: giving him four hits over his career . 	 " The last couple of outings have been a slow progression
column29: " Kazmir said . " End of the game
column30: you 've got to stay humble . Everything is going better and better . I 'm excited . I 'm going to take a lot of positives out of this outing and keep it going . " 	 Yasiel Puig made another dazzling defensive play for the Dodgers
column31: a diving catch to rob Yadier Molina of a hit in the second inning . He had three hits a day earlier to shake some rust at the plate
column33: Puig was 0 for 3 . 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM 	 Cardinals : RHP Seth Mannes was placed on the 15 - day disabled list with right elbow inflammation . 	 Dodgers : LHP Hyun - Jin Ryu ( left shoulder surgery ) will make his first rehab start at Class A Rancho Cucamonga on Sunday
column34: where he is expected to throw two innings . Dave Roberts said he 'll probably make four or five minor league starts to build up to 100 pitches . ...
